caption: Stopped in for brunch. Portions were well planned, and a la carte pricing was upscale but not wholly unreasonable. I enjoyed the french toast (prepared casserole style with a tasty tart compote) and the hefty breakfast sausages. It was rich and far more filling than the simple size of it would suggest. My dining partner had the Belgian waffle which was light and fluffy and topped with fresh fruit, not syrupy glaze. Service was attentive and cordial, suggesting upscale dining even in hoodies and sneakers. Will dine again!
Great restaurant, ended up dinning here with the Staycation package. Thought the staycation menu was limited, food was great, service was great! Would recommend highly.
"French toast" and omelettes were great! Wish I could have tried one of the fantastic sounding cocktails!
They change the menu without texting you to let you know so that you can make up your mind about eating there.
Good food, nice ambiance.
Food is awesome. Service is great
A delight! A beautiful setting with delicious food.

We stayed at the Curtiss hotel and had reservations for brunch here at 11 a.m.  We wanted to sit at the bar- it spins and we were unable to experience this as it was full all weekend.  As soon as we sat down the staff was rude to us- complained that they were still setting up for the day and it "would be difficult to serve us." They opened at 11 am and it was.....11 am.  Very unprofessional. We left and went to the 31 club restaurant down the road.  Was amazing, great service and we were seated right away.

Jumbalaya worth trying definitely if it's in your tastes, salads are plentiful and the filet was cooked to perfection. Plenty of pink, no blood. Handmade cocktails were excellent, plenty of flavor and not sweeteners.
Great Food Great Service
My long island was disgusting,  couldn't even drink it.  This was about my fourth time here and had a bad experience every time.
Food was incredible. The filet was one of the best steaks I've ever had. Mussels were a great choice for an appetizer as well! Definitely will be coming back again.
Loved the menu. Excellent staff.

Chez Ami is a charming, classy, yet comfortable place to dine that I would recommend to anyone. We were greeted by a warm staff and seated on the beautiful outdoor patio. There, our server was very professional, kind, warm, and attentive and provided excellent service throughout the evening. I ordered the meatball starter and as a main dish ordered the Alaskan cod, alongside some wine. Both dishes tasted phenomenal and I would recommend this place for anyone looking to have an enjoyable dinner experience.
Great place

One of the most flavorful steak sandwiches I’ve ever had! The steak was cooked to how I wanted it and maple-soy sauce was a great compliment with the caramelized onions and mushrooms. The breakfast potatoes were also very flavorful and crispy too! Can’t wait to come back and try something else of their brunch menu!

I've been here 4 or 5 times and I've been pleased every time. This last visit was with some friends. We all ordered off the special staycation menu. I always get the fall salad which consists of mixed greens, fresh apple slices, craisins, pecans, blue cheese and citrus vinaigrette. I love the sweet and savory. For dinner I ordered the boneless short rib with polenta. It was so huge that I couldn't finish it all, I wanted to save room for dessert which is my favorite. The apple almond bread pudding with a side of vanilla gelato drizzled with caramel... delicious!
Loved it

I came here for a V day dinner expecting a nice meal with good cocktails. My first complaint was that they had a “special” menu which did not match the one posted online when I booked the table, which showed vegetarian options. The special menu had no vegetarian options at all, only salad. The server, a nice-enough young man, told us they could prepare a vegetable and pasta dish, so I went along, not having any other options, very hungry and already feeling the cocktail. The pasta dish and my partners dish came out suspiciously early. My pasta was intolerably disappointing, a weirdly almost curry-spiced soupy pile of angel hair pasta with some sad, soggy cooked tomatoes (and no other vegetables). It truly tasted and looked horrible. For context, I’m a very good cook and I could tell zero effort was expended on this meal and am confident I can cook 10x better. However, my partner appeared to relish his roasted chicken dish.  I complained to my server who took back the plate with no questions asked and took my order for a salad in its place. The salad was okay but contained huge unchopped halves of baby lettuce and was deeply unsatisfying for my hunger. The portion size was insultingly small and for the taste and effort expended, it was overpriced.  The cocktails were good. My server was nice. The rest of the staff had a weird, cold vibe. Including the hostess who repeatedly asked us if we had a reservation, yes we did, we had even called to confirm. We were told the patio lounge was “lit” by the whitest guy imaginable. We went upstairs to find the expected set of middle management type Gen Xers and R’n’B from the 2000’s. The patio was too cold to really sit out on. It was really pathetically lame. Obviously being a weird group of socially isolated straight white people, nobody was talking to each other, just the person they came with. Thank u, next.  I will never revisit this lame and disappointing establishment. I can’t believe they bombastically bill themselves as a “world class” restaurant. A world class restaurant would be able to whip up an acceptable pasta dish. Hell, give me some tomatoes, garlic, basil and tomato paste and I can whip up a GREAT pasta dish! They could have even offered me a quinoa side dish I saw with one of the other meals. The total lack of respect was shown in the poor care given and poor food that was served. If you are looking for an extravagant, nice night out (which is so rarely something I indulge in), this is not it. It’s as if everything is a mirage, the interiors are nice but littered with dead bugs, an appropriate symbol for the entire experience. Maybe they didn’t respect me because I’m relatively young (27) for their demo and Indian-American, but that is just another reason to avoid this place like plague if you are anyone like me. I have been to truly world class restaurants in Montreal, where I am treated warmly and respectfully, and there is no problem making dietary accommodations. This is really just a cheap place that’s overpriced.
Visited on a trip to Buffalo. It was a beautiful place. The food and service excellent.
Nice, small menu.  Great service.

Very pretentious vibe here. Food prices DO NOT match quality at all. All extremely underwhelming, lack of seasonings and presently blandly. Staff looks very miserable and we didn’t get a friendly vibe here. Avoid
Food was awesome, atmosphere was great, service was great as well.

Had a really nice dinner there. Small restaurant space within the Curtis hotel but a very well put together room with lots of high end finishes and an elegant decor. Stop for a drink at the revolving bar and then enjoy a lovely meal

The limited New Years Eve menu was executed terribly, the food was bland the potatoes were hardly cooked and there was no bread. When dinner is over $100/person you should bring your A-game and atleast have some other options for sides then some cold potato puree.

This was a $50 lunch for two people, and it definitely wasn't worth it. The club sandwich was good, but nothing I couldn't have gotten at any deli. An order of French fries was $9!  We asked for ketchup and the waitress brought us a little metal cup (for two people!).  When we asked for more she brought us another little metal cup. Apparently not having a ketchup bottle on the table is a thing there.  I see no reason to go back.
Expensive food and poor customer service
Very nice great staff and very good food

The environment was wonderful, relaxed but elegant. While the menu is short on options, the food was distinctly and carefully prepared and was the highlight of the evening.  The cocktails were brilliant, highest quality mixed with delicate creativity, a wonderful beginning to an amazing evening.

Went to the restaurant for lunch with a group of friends.  The service and food were good. Nice selection of beer and drinks.  Have outdoor seating when the weather is good.  Have a nice rotating bar area. Would go back.
Food was delicious and the ambiance was perfect.

Came here on a Saturday evening after checking out the rooftop bar/lounge first (our bartender Andrew was amazing) This three-course dinner was included in the staycation package. We had the choice of soup or salad. We both opted for a salad one Caesar and one fall salad. For the entrees we had the salmon and the braised short rib. And for our dessert, cheesecake and the bread pudding. All of the portions were huge and tasted great. The restaurant itself is beautiful as well as the exceptional service from Timofey.
Great food and service.
Food was outstanding! Atmosphere was vibrant. Enjoyed the evening.

Celebrating 45 years of marriage to a wonderful man. Our children gave us gift certificates to use. Hubby had short ribs with wilted Swiss chard and polenta. Tender and tasty. I had veal marsala with a variety of mushrooms on linquine. Also quite tasty. Beautiful setting and atmosphere.
Located in the very upscale Curtis Hotel with excellent cuisine at moderate prices. A very nice dining experience.
Food was average. Service was not great...Waiter never replaced napkin after a spill.

My Wife and I can here in late August for her birthday dinner. I was recommended by a friend. The restaurant was beautiful but the seating arrangements were horrible. They were way too close together. I could hear everyone’s conversations. Our waitress would take 10 minutes to bring our drinks. (we had Root Beer) She also didn’t seem to want to do her job. She wasn’t rude just gave the impression she didn’t like her job. The food was pretty good. I had the half roasted chicken and my wife had a filet. The food wasn’t worth the price. The Overall experience was okay. I probably won’t go back. Happy I gave it a try though. Hotel is gorgeous. I recommend the bar on the roof.

My wife and I went for brunch today. The food was very good but the service was horrible. It was not busy, but we waited at least 10 minutes to get a waiter to come to our table, then 10 more minutes for coffee and juice to arrive. Our food was served over 45 minutes after we first arrived. This staff seemed very inexperienced. I felt horrible for a large party that had children with them who were having the same issues we were. After airing their displeasure, the manager came out and actually began arguing with them, in earshot of all, about their complaints. Despite the good food, it was a very disappointing experience and we won’t be back!
Amazing braised beef dinner, my wife liked the monkfish.  Kevin our server made the recommendation for my wife, very knowledgeable about the menu.  Highly recommend a nice dress up night out
FOOD -  4 STARS ATMOSPHERE - 5 STARS SERVICE - 5 STARS PRICE - $$
Food is mediocre at Chez restaurant downstairs, but the rooftop lounge at the top makes up for it.
It was fabulous!!!?
Went for an office lunch service and food was great atmosphere was nice
Great service and very accommodating.. brunch was amazing !
My youngest son had a small wedding and we eat dinner here. I cant remember the waitresses name but she was awesome. The service was just great and there was no waiting for the servers to show up.
Very pleasant, tasty menu, interesting street view in the atrium dining room. Rather pricey except for the limited time 2fers menu. Pleasant service.
Good food not so good service
Came here for BOGO lunch. Decent food, but the normal prices are higher than maybe they should be, for the quality and portion size.

Ate off their stay cation menu. They were able to make a vegan dish which was great. I had the beef and it was excellent on how it was cooked through and seasoning. I normally am not impressed by most steak houses so this was a great win for me.
BIG LETDOWN!  Overpriced for the quality of food and drinks. Mushroom pizza was oversaturated with oil. Sparkling Rose was discolored and tasted old. Moscow Mule not even served in copper mug.
Great food, excellent prices

Food was excellent, service was good-not great. My big pet peeve is that the dress code is not enforced- everyone was dressed up at least business casual and the table next to us was people in jeans and tee-shirts.
Chelsea made the whole experience wo fearful.  Great service

Went to this place for my daughter's birthday dinner. Food was fantastic. Signature drinks were great. Atmosphere was even better. Great vibe! A little pricey, but worth it for a special occasion. Staff was excellent!
The chez ami restaurant at Curtiss has great portions and Great food the manager Bruce was incredibly helpful and very friendly highly recommend this place.

Repost of a review for this restaurant I accidentally put on the page for the hotel in which it's located which I have deleted. Minor edits made as well. My visit was on 12-18-18: Ok so here's the thing. Company department went for a work dinner. When I found out where we were going, I was a little unsure about it as I had read some bad reviews of the restaurant online. Firstly, this place is expensive. I was surprised that the entrees do not come with sides which are equally expensive. $8 for a bread basket? $13 for a Caesar salad? Ridiculous. Especially considering that entrees are $29+. Now we were a fairly large group of 11, but it was completely dead and service was slow. It was about 5 minutes wait for drink refills after being asked if we wanted one (mostly draft beers and in my case an iced tea). It took about an hour from everyone being seated and ordering until we started being served. As I stated, I ordered iced tea because I don't drink alcohol) I would think that a place as "upscale" and expensive as this would have fresh brewed tea, but it was Lipton Brisk which I don't consider to be tea - it's sugar water with some food coloring (and that's a generous description). Now I'll admit, that's on me for not asking before ordering. Now, for the food review. I ordered the filet mignon (8 oz for $49!) cooked medium because I don't like a lot of pink in my steaks. Because it took so long, the steak didn't come out piping hot as you would expect (I do understand that meat should rest for a bit before being served) but rather what I would describe as a little warmer than warm. It also had A LOT of pink so I think it was done medium rare or rare instead of medium. I bit the bullet because it was a work function and I didn't want to be that guy to make a scene. That being said, I thought the steak was absolutely delicious. It was probably the best steak I've had in my entire life; it was full of flavor and just melted in my mouth like butter. I would have loved to give this a 5 star review but with the amount of time it took to get served when there was almost no one else at the restaurant (maybe two or three different couples but certainly not any other large parties) and the time waiting for refills, and the food not being as hot as I felt it should or could have been, I can't give it more than 4 stars. The staff was great, very friendly, and our main server looked a bit like a redheaded Benedict Cumberbatch. I may consider returning for a special occasion but definitely not casually.

Food was all good and staff was friendly. We loved the atmosphere. The only reason I am giving 4 stars is because some of the food was under/over seasoned for our tastes - not enough salt, too much vinegar, for example... Overall though we will certainly return for another escape out.
Great Food, awesome atmosphere, fantastic service.
Fantastic food, exceptional customer service, awesome atmosphere!

The bartenders are friendly and usually pretty quick to fill your order. Unfortunately everything is overpriced for the quality you get, the food is mediocre at best. It's a shame, I had such high expectations for the restaurant since The Curtiss is by far my favorite place to stay in the city.
Food was average, little pricey for what you got. Revolving bar was unique and the staff was friendly.

I went to Brunch Sunday December. 30,2018 Not pleased at all with the food or the Chef (I say chef loosely) I was served BURNT pancakes with a plate full of pieces of pancake crumbs and another person in my party's pancakes were RAW Runny and Disgusting. Appauld that they had the audacity to serve us that GARBAGE. I can't post the picture to Fb page. I have proof what's your email address?????
Good food and ambiance
Best salads in town, Jordan is great at it but no one is better at tossing salads than Forrest.

Stylish, classy restaurant in the Curtiss Hotel. Menu includes favorites like Filet Mignon, Salmon and gourmet pizzas. Also novel dishes like a grilled  squash salad. Portions are generous. Service is professional and friendly.
Went for lunch. Cant beat a biy one get one fifty percent off burger, which was cooked to perfection!!!! Id def recommend trying the burgers.

Very unimpressed. Atmosphere is beautiful but brunch was a bust. We were celebrating my in-laws 60th wedding anniversary and thought it would be an extra special and beautiful venue.  Dry dry dry dry food all around the table of 10. Food was cold or just warm,  eggs  benedict was no better than some I could get at a family restaurant, Monte Cristo sandwiches looked unappetising and hash and potatoes were super dry.  The eggs benedict took up less than a quarter of the plate...maybe a tablespoon of hollandaise sauce on each egg.  Presentation on every plate was nothing special...a sprinkle of parsley. When I made the reservation I told them it would be a 60th anniversary celebration and the hostess said she would write that on the reservation, all they came up with was a quick happy anniversary after we asked the waitress to take a group picture before we left. Maybe I was expecting too much..I thought they might surprise them with a special drink or something.  I wouldn't go back. They need to step it up if they expect people to come from the towns outside of Buffalo. Left us so disappointed.
Not worth the price. Atmosphere was loud and food just mediocre. There is much better out there
Amazing meal, incredible decor.  Please come to Charlotte!
Good food but service was not very good, expected more..
Great, great lunch.. service a little slow, but the excellent food and surroundings more than make up for it!
The best fine dining in Buffalo. Great food, great service. The food is excellent!
The best hotel & restaurant in downtown Buffalo.
Great meal in a beautiful setting! Great renovation

Fabulous service, delicious cocktails and the revolving bar adds a very fun touch!  Mark Croce and company have done an amazing job of bringing class and elegance back to Buffalo nightlife.  Not to be missed
Is this the rooftop bar? I don't remember, I was pretty hammered. Cool decor, confusing bathrooms.

I really wanted to like this place. Beautiful decor in a nice hotel, with stylish table setting. Dishes were hit or miss - I tried the scallops, grilled octopus, pork belly and broccolini. Grilled octopus was dry with no flavor; broccolini was good, but there quite a few tough stalks at the end. Pork belly was ok but quite fatty - which is to be expected. Scallops were delicious - which gives me hope that perhaps there were other items on the menu that were just as good. Service was super slow - the server (Emily) took a very long time to greet me and take my order, and even longer to take my bill at the end. It wasn't a bad dining experience, there are probably just many other places that are worth going to than this one.
Homemade gnocchi was delicious!
Great food, great service!!

Had a nightcap here recently. Service was good, selection of drinks was pretty good. Rotating bar....not so good. The pace of revolution is fine, but the subtle constant movement was not appreciated by my partner. Maybe just one person’s opinion.  Drinks were fine, a little sweet. Overall decor is a bit heavy on carera marble.
Always excellent food and service! Great menu
Waiter Terrance was really good but my Salmon was completely raw. Very disappointed as it complete turn my stomach being 8 months pregnant. Also the manager did not come over and apologize.

Typical Buffalo/WNY. Business.  Incompetent staff,  rude,  don't understand what customer service is a so far behind the times other than the hotel's tech.  No Vegan options,  no real dairy free options.  Very limited menu with. Subpar food.  As usual Buffalo doesn't know what a real 5 star restaurant is.  Lots of other places to go in Buffalo.  The Henry is one of them.  They get it!
Poor service, overcooked food, high priced, no thanks.
Incredible!  Thanks Steven and Max!   Awesome food, great service, killer drinks.  Get one of everything!

I don't know where to start on this one. I went to enjoy lunch by myself so let's start with that and took 18 min to get a water. I walked in with only seeing the bartender asking where to sit. He said bar or seating, I choose seating always. I waited and was greated awkwardly however she seated me then briefly after the waiter arrived. I asked what type of cider do you carry; she quickly said Stella. She arrived 15 min later with a different cider and stared to pour it. I mentioned that is not a Stella miss.  Their was no one sitting or enjoying beverages at the bar so I'm not sure why it took so long in the first place. This was only said to myself at this point. I was asked if I would like anything else, I replied with anything sweet. This one took another 10 min to arrive with finally a water that should be serverd when you sit down. The $17 porkbelly blt was half fat, which you would think a $17 small sandwhich would be well sorted without a 1/4" slab if fat in the while sanwhich. The margarita pizza was the best part and it bursting with flavors. Very disarisfied with the service and quality of a high class restaurant $17 sand which and lack of serving water and beverage before I get my meal. Yes that's right I did not get any sort of beverage until after I was served my lunches.
Rib eye delicious
Food is good. Love their lunch special! Haven’t had the opportunity to try the bar but I know it’s what they’re known for! Will return for lunch with friends on a regular basis.
Great food ..revolving bar is one of a kind
The space is beautiful in a Vegas-type way but the pizza was overpriced and under cooked.  Cool rotating bar serves delicious though pricey cocktails.
First time there - for Thanksgiving dinner.  Food, drinks  and service was excellent.  Will definitely go back soon.

Wife and friends waited over 2 hours for entrees. Manger's were defensive and generally disrespectful. Buffalo's a small town. Responding to criticism in this way is not going to go unnoticed. With all the new places opening up around town, I'd avoid this one..

After reading reviews about this place being new and the service hasn't fully been sorted but well worth it regardless I took my wife here for her birthday.  I'd have to say the majority of reviews I read stating that the service wasn't up to par yet but the food was very good were spot on.  With one exception we loved the food...I wouldn't recommend the Berkshire Pork Belly small plate as it had only 1 very small piece of pork and I've had similar dishes at similar type restaurants and this was just a total rip off.  If the piece weighed 1/8 ounce I'd be surprised.  C'Est la Vie.  I will return but forgo the small plate stuff.  My wife had the octopus which was fantastic and of normal portion size.  For dinner we enjoyed Strip loin and Salmon w/ mussels.  Both were very enjoyable.  The waiter although very friendly (fits the name...Chez Ami) but would disappear for much too long, so they haven't "figured it out" just yet.
True elegance!

The food was good. The service was not as good as it should have been. The atmosphere was nice and trendy. It was, however, a pretentious one. We ordered Brussels sprouts and after our other food arrived we were told about 5 minutes later that they were out of Brussels sprouts. I'm not sure I would go back.
Best food I have had in Buffalo so far.
A new Buffalo hot spot. This place is spectacular...it has wonderful service, great food, and a rotating bar! My wife and I had lunch on the windowed-in patio area...was lovely.

First review? I'd be glad to!!  All I can say is go. Just go. The food is amazing. Just amazing. Having ordered (and shared without shame) 3 small plates, 5 large, as well as every dessert on the menu...you can trust me on this.  I've lived in Buffalo 10 years now and been to just about every fine dining restaurant this great city has to offer, and this was by far the best experience of them all. What was supposed to just be a simple dinner with family turned into a memorable 3 hour event filled with incredible food and impeccable service (Craig!).  Oh, and also...the place is STUNNING!!!  Mr. Croce, you've done it again!
